trans-unit.source: Unable to process PEM X.509 data of private key "{name}". Only PEM encoded X.509 files are supported.
trans-unit.target: Unable to process PEM X.509 data of private key "{name}". Only PEM encoded X.509 files are supported.

trans-unit.source: The certificate public-key does not match with the private-key "public-key" data.
trans-unit.target: The certificate public-key does not match with the private-key "public-key" data.

trans-unit.source: The certificate does not match with the provided private-key.
trans-unit.target: The certificate does not match with the provided private-key.

trans-unit.source: This certificate was signed using the weak "{provided}" algorithm. Expected at least algorithm "{expected}".".
trans-unit.target: This certificate was signed using the weak "{provided}" algorithm. Expected at least algorithm "{expected}".".

trans-unit.source: The private-key bits-size {provided} is too low. Expected at least {expected} bits.
trans-unit.target: The private-key bits-size {provided} is too low. Expected at least {expected} bits.

trans-unit.source: The certificate with serial-number "{serial}" was marked as revoked on { revoked_on, date, short } with ({reason_code}) {reason}.
trans-unit.target: The certificate with serial-number "{serial}" was marked as revoked on { revoked_on, date, short } with ({reason_code}) {reason}.

trans-unit.source: The certificate with common-name "{common_name}" contains a CA extension. Expected a leaf certificate.
trans-unit.target: The certificate with common-name "{common_name}" contains a CA extension. Expected a leaf certificate.

trans-unit.source: This certificate has expired on { expired_on, date, short }.
trans-unit.target: This certificate has expired on { expired_on, date, short }.

trans-unit.source: This certificate should support host pattern "{required_pattern}". But only the following patterns are {supported}
trans-unit.target: This certificate should support host pattern "{required_pattern}". But only the following patterns are {supported}

trans-unit.source: This certificate does not support the {required_purpose}
trans-unit.target: This certificate does not support the {required_purpose}

trans-unit.source: The certificate host "{provided}" contains an invalid global-wildcard pattern.
trans-unit.target: The certificate host "{provided}" contains an invalid global-wildcard pattern.

trans-unit.source: The certificate host "{provided}" contains an invalid public-suffix wildcard pattern "{suffix_pattern}".
trans-unit.target: The certificate host "{provided}" contains an invalid public-suffix wildcard pattern "{suffix_pattern}".

trans-unit.source: Unable to resolve CA of certificate "{name}".
trans-unit.target: Unable to resolve CA of certificate "{name}".

trans-unit.source: unspecified (no specific reason was given).
trans-unit.target: unspecified (no specific reason was given).

trans-unit.source: the private key associated with the certificate has been compromised.
trans-unit.target: the private key associated with the certificate has been compromised.

trans-unit.source: the CAs private key is has been compromised and is in the possession of an unauthorized individual. When a CAs private key is revoked, this results in all certificates issued by the CA that are signed using the private key associated with the revoked certificate being considered revoked.
trans-unit.target: the CAs private key is has been compromised and is in the possession of an unauthorized individual. When a CAs private key is revoked, this results in all certificates issued by the CA that are signed using the private key associated with the revoked certificate being considered revoked.

trans-unit.source: the user has terminated their relationship with the organization indicated in the Distinguished Name attribute of the certificate. This revocation code is typically used when an individual is terminated or has resigned from an organization.
trans-unit.target: the user has terminated their relationship with the organization indicated in the Distinguished Name attribute of the certificate. This revocation code is typically used when an individual is terminated or has resigned from an organization.

trans-unit.source: a replacement certificate has been issued to a user.
trans-unit.target: a replacement certificate has been issued to a user.

trans-unit.source: the CA is decommissioned, no longer to be used.
trans-unit.target: the CA is decommissioned, no longer to be used.

trans-unit.source: the certificate (public-key or attribute certificate) was revoked because a privilege contained within that certificate has been withdrawn.
trans-unit.target: the certificate (public-key or attribute certificate) was revoked because a privilege contained within that certificate has been withdrawn.

trans-unit.source: it is known or suspected that aspects of the AA validated in the attribute certificate have been compromised.
trans-unit.target: it is known or suspected that aspects of the AA validated in the attribute certificate have been compromised.
